Minimum System Requirements

* Operating System: Microsoft Windows Vista (Windows XP not supported)
* CPU: Intel Core 2 Duo 2.6 GHz or AMD Phenom X3 2.4GHz or similar
* RAM: 2 GB System memory
* Hard Disk Space: 10 GB available space
* Video Card: DX10 compatible graphics card with 256 MB memory (Nvidia GeForce 8800 series/ ATI Radeon HD 2600 Pro)
* Sound Card: 100% DirectX 10 compatible sound card
* DirectX: Microsoft DirectX 10 

Recommended System Requirements

* Operating System: Windows 7
* CPU: Intel Core i5 M540 or similar
* RAM: 3 GB system memory
* Hard Disk Space: 10 GB available space
* Video Card: DX10 compatible graphics card with 512 MB memory (Nvidia GeForce GTS 250 series/ ATI Radeon HD 5750 series)
* Sound Card: 100% DirectX 10 compatible Dolby Digital 5.1 sound card
* DirectX: Microsoft DirectX 10.1

@ohos -- my own antivirus didn't detect it when scanning the setup.exe.  That does not mean there isn't a virus in the setup.  My AV picked it up when it was installing consvr.dll to the windows\system32 folder.  After aborting the install on my gaming PC, I installed it on a test PC, and again both my spyware app and AV didn't pick it up until setup.exe installed consvr.dll to windows\system32.  Upon rebooting, I could no longer connect to the network with the test PC and the firewall was disabled.  At that point I began getting nonstop warnings from my AV and spyware apps that the PC was infected, and subsequent efforts to remove the virus failed.  

This is definitely not a false positive.

Well I dont know why people write some of these comments, or have had virus issues installing this but i can confirm it is clean via mse (Microsoft Security Essentials) fully updated, both the files in the torrent, what is installed to the Sega folder after the game is installed via the iso, and also once the cracks are applied. I also took the liberty of playing the game, which works great if you have a dx10 graphics card, and then performing a custom scan on Windows/System32....surprise surprise....no virus.
  For the record I had nothing that popped up asking for permission to taskmanager or anything else, the only pop up I got was asking me whether i let the game have access to the internet; and as this is not a release i am going to play online i declined. The game booted up fine, and is great fun. Once again Extremezone, a perfect upload. If you noobs cant come up with a thankyou or something constructive with backup evidence of these "viruses".....Fuck off. To everyone else enjoy the game.

Ok, I'll explain what kind of virus is embedded on the Setup.exe. It's not actually in the installer exe itself but in the setup bins which where the Setup installer extracts the files to be installed. Didn't I say in my previous post the VIRUS (Rootkit.ZeroAccess) is ONE OF THE MOST SOPHISTICATED VIRUS that is good at hiding and sneaking on your system. It infects your DRIVERS! Disables your Anti-Virus and Firewall, Infects & messes up your TCP/IP and blocks Anti-Virus/Malware Sites.

Proof: Kaspersky Anti-Virus 2012
http://www.postimg.com/image/51000/photo-50866.jpg
http://www.postimg.com/image/51000/photo-50868.jpg

And YES! SKIDROWS Original Upload was CLEAN! *THIS ONE IS TAMPERED! I just downloaded another one from a private tracker and is CLEAN. I don't know if extremezone tampered the Setup or maybe he himself is unaware that he's infected by a ZeroAccess. Take note that virus can access sites your unaware of, like clicking and viewing a site for traffic or for a huge DDOS attack. (Means your PC will be a Zombie)
More worse is why does it infect your TCP/IP and disables your firewall? Well obviously to download more malware/virus to heavily infect your system. The most vulnerable ones are with 32-bit systems.
